summary: This is an email chain from August 2019 regarding a 'Psych Review' of inmates at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, specifically concerning inmates on watch or psych alert. The email instructs a review to ensure proper evaluation, housing, and documentation, and mentions notifying someone once complete. The context suggests this relates to oversight of inmate mental health statuses, possibly in the period around Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration.

events.title: Psych Review Directive
events.description: Instruction for a Psych Services employee to review all inmates currently on watch, recently on watch, or on Psych Alert at the MCC to ensure proper evaluation, housing, and documentation.

keyFacts: The email is dated August 12, 2019, which is shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest on July 6, 2019, and before his death on August 10, 2019.
It orders a review of all inmates on psych watch or alert at the MCC to verify proper procedures were followed.
The directive was to be completed 'first thing tomorrow' (August 13, 2019), indicating urgency.
The email chain involves prison staff discussing inmate mental health monitoring protocols.
The context suggests institutional attention to inmate psychological statuses in the MCC around the time of Epstein's incarceration and death.
